Oh, "Overwatch 2," where do I even begin? It's as if the creators took a look at all the things that made the original great and thought, "How can we dilute that?"

First of all, the innovative features. Oh, wait, I couldn't find them. It seems that the creative energy put into the first game went on vacation this time around, leaving us with a sequel that feels more like a repetitive retread than a groundbreaking follow-up.

Now, let's talk about the balance, or should I say, imbalance? The heroes you once loved are either overpowered or laughably weak. It's almost like a game of chance to find the right character to play, unless you enjoy losing, of course.

Graphics? Stunning, if you're still living in 2016. For those of us in the present, the lack of visual improvements is a slap in the face. We get it, if it's not broken, don't fix it â€“ but maybe a slight upgrade wouldn't hurt?

And the maps, oh, the maps! A glorious tapestry of dÃ©jÃ  vu awaits you as you traverse landscapes that will have you wondering if you've played this game before. Spoiler alert: You have.

In conclusion, "Overwatch 2" delivers a masterclass in how to take a beloved franchise and make it less exciting, less innovative, and more frustrating. If you're longing for the days of the original but with a slightly different logo, then this game might be right up your alley. Otherwise, buckle up for a rollercoaster ride of disappointment and mediocrity. Bravo, Blizzard, bravo.

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.
